# label

**Instance Property**

A view that describes the effect of switching the toggle between states.

## Declaration

```swift
let label: ToggleStyleConfiguration.Label
```

## Discussion

Use this value in your implementation of the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToggleStyle/makeBody(configuration:)] method when defining a custom [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToggleStyle]. Access it through the that method’s `configuration` parameter.

Because the label is a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View], you can incorporate it into the view hierarchy that you return from your style definition. For example, you can combine the label with a circle image in an [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/HStack]:

```swift
HStack {
    Image(systemName: configuration.isOn
        ? "checkmark.circle.fill"
        : "circle")
    configuration.label
}
```

## Getting the label view

- **ToggleStyleConfiguration.Label**: A type-erased label of a toggle.
